channel.title: Well this is one way to make money

item.title: Well this is one way to make money
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Pink Phat:

Yes, and thousands of bots will quit, too.

Anyone suicide botting is stupid to pay members and they will only pay for 1 month

Read full topic
item.source: Well this is one way to make money

item.title: Well this is one way to make money
item.dc:creator: @Pink_Phat Pink Phat
item.description:
@Pink_Phat wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:35, topic:459766"][quote author=Pink Phat link=topic=562671.msg4110916#msg4110916 date=1348512178]

[quote author=Ambokile link=topic=562671.msg4110851#msg4110851 date=1348503022]

If they did what the community wanted, they would be bankrupt in less than a year.
[/quote]100% agree! What the community wants and how it would affect the economy would destroy the game

They don’t care about how it affects the economy, as long as they are making money they are happy.
[/quote]totally untrue. If you had listened to their most recent livestream about bots. They even mentioned in their they admitted they knew this would affect the economy majorly.

Please don’t make stupid comments.

I just told you that RuneScape don’t care about the economy, hence why they went through with the bot thing. Less bots = more happy members = more money for them.

How is less bots more money?

Less bots = items go up in price = money becomes worth more = players more willing to buy spins because money will be harder to gain

Less bots = less members = less profits for Jagex.

Less bots= legit players come back = more profit for jagex.

Hundreds or even thousands have quit because of bots.[/quote]
Yes, and thousands of bots will quit, too.

Read full topic
item.source: Well this is one way to make money

what they really need to do is reset all accounts
[/quote]

Right when SUOMI maxes.[/quote]
“Boy commits suicide over online game”

Read full topic

item.title: Well this is one way to make money
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:44, topic:459766”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=562671.msg4111138#msg4111138 date=1348525816]

I would be happy if all accs were reset.

I concur. Fix botting and reset everything.

Botting will never be fixed in its entirety… Not with the approaches they’ve been taking at least. If they handed out stricter punishments where applicable, maybe then as well.
[/quote]

I thought they fixed all bots 'cept for screen scrapers when botany bay was released… it has been released right?[/quote]
I haven’t a clue. Just, bots will return when there is more exploits found.

Read full topic

item.title: Well this is one way to make money
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

Davidi2:

I’m sorry, but there is no way in hell that there are more people that will come back than there were bots. Jagex is DEFINITELY losing money over this. People don’t even realize that the majority of bots were not people you see botting for 99s, most of them were just suicide botters for rsgp. Also the damage of bots has already been done for people that cared about them (ie, people that thought training became pointless), because the stats have already been gained and it probably wont balance out for years (if ever).

Exactly. They should of sorted it before it became a massive problem which they said they could do.
Another lie from Jagex

OT: I’m glad people are doing this, RS is ruined so bad but they try to make it push forwards…

Read full topic
item.source: Well this is one way to make money

item.title: Well this is one way to make money
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I’m sorry, but there is no way in hell that there are more people that will come back than there were bots. Jagex is DEFINITELY losing money over this. People don’t even realize that the majority of bots were not people you see botting for 99s, most of them were just suicide botters for rsgp. Also the damage of bots has already been done for people that cared about them (ie, people that thought training became pointless), because the stats have already been gained and it probably wont balance out for years (if ever).

Read full topic

They don’t care about how it affects the economy, as long as they are making money they are happy.
[/quote]totally untrue. If you had listened to their most recent livestream about bots. They even mentioned in their they admitted they knew this would affect the economy majorly.

Please don’t make stupid comments.

I just told you that RuneScape don’t care about the economy, hence why they went through with the bot thing. Less bots = more happy members = more money for them.

How is less bots more money?

Less bots = items go up in price = money becomes worth more = players more willing to buy spins because money will be harder to gain

Less bots = less members = less profits for Jagex.[/quote]
Less bots= legit players come back = more profit for jagex.

Hundreds or even thousands have quit because of bots.

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Pssssssst. If items go up in price it means money becomes worth LESS (meaning 1m now will be worth less than 1m in a few months), which means making money will be easier for legit players.

Read full topic

item.title: Well this is one way to make money
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:23, topic:459766”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=562671.msg4110045#msg4110045 date=1348432283]

Does anyone still want to challenge me on the fact that Jagex has been in it for the money for some time now?

a company looking to make a profit? how fucking absurd

When you go against what your community wants, it’s absurd. You’d think they’d make more money and have better credibility if they stuck with the community more than the investors.
[/quote]they don’t have the say so, as the investors are the majority share holders they must do what they wish

I love this comment too, what makes you guys think the investors have any input to the game design? a person that invests in stock generally does not have input in how the company operates.

If you control over 50% you do have an input.[/quote]
You have the choice. They would not get involved in game design as they are not game designers and they could lose money if they make bad decisions. They most likely told Jagex to introduce microtransactions and this is what Jagex did. I have trouble picturing a group of businessmen saying to add a spinning wheel owned by a goblin

Read full topic
item.source: Well this is one way to make money
